subject: AI
title: Toxicity Detection
description: Measuring and preventing harmful content in AI outputs.

hook.text: A chatbot deployed for children starts using mild profanity after a user figures out how to bypass the safety prompt. No one catches it for a week.

buildup.text: Toxicity metrics measure whether AI outputs contain harmful, offensive, or inappropriate content. This includes profanity, hate speech, personal attacks, and unsafe advice.

discovery.text: Use classifier models (Perspective API, OpenAI moderation endpoint) to score every output. Set a threshold: any response scoring above 0.7 toxicity gets blocked and logged for review.

twist.text: Toxicity is context-dependent. A medical AI discussing 'drug interactions' isn't toxic. A gaming chatbot discussing 'killing enemies' is expected. Tune classifiers to your domain.

climax.text: Build toxicity checking into your eval pipeline AND your production pipeline. Eval catches patterns; production checking catches individual incidents in real time.

punchline.text: If your AI can talk, it can say something wrong. Monitor for it.

quiz.question: Why is toxicity detection context-dependent?
options: All text is equally toxic regardless of context
Terms acceptable in one domain (medical, gaming) may be flagged in another
